result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominick M Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court ordered restitution in the stipulated amount of $14,936.66 and $3835.26 to Crime Victim Compensation Program.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to each other and with any other sentence with credit for 0 days served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain employment.
Participate in job and vocational training.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

No contact with victims Raj S. and Vishal V.
No alcohol or controlled substances (unless mental health of physical treatment as prescribed by licensed physician).

Mental health assessment; treatment, if needed.
Participate in Anger management counseling.

AODA assessment; treatment, if needed.
Urine screens- the Court recommends revocation upon any dirty urine analysis.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to each other and any with other sentence with credit for 0 days served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominick M Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: reflects CORRECT restitution amounts as ordered by the court
FILED:  ORIGINAL TRANSCRIPT (25 pages) of Sentencing Hearing held on 7-06-15 before the Honorable Dennis P. Moroney.
ORDER TO PRODUCE, MONDAY, JULY 06, 2015 AT 1:30 P.M. IN BR 20, SB RM 113, kl

Defendant Dominick M Smith in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Dominick M Smith in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 2 as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20 on 7/06/15 at 1:30 p.m.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Dominick M Smith not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominick M Smith in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Dominick M Smith in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Department Detective Michael Tanem.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20. Next Court date selected to accomodate Defense attorney scheduling conflict without objection of the State.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered cash bail CONTINUED at $10,000.00 with TOT to Justice Point; no alcohol or drugs; no firearms; no contact order remains.

Defendant Dominick M Smith in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Dominick M Smith in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's report reviewed by all parties.  Neither the State nor defense challenge its findings.  Court has colloquy with defendant regarding whether or not he believes he is competent to proceed.  Defendant states that he believes he is competent.  Based upon all the information received, the Court ordered proceedings reinstated and continued matter before Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Dominick M Smith not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's report just received yesterday; defense counsel needs time to go over report with defendant; defendant also in custody due to a pending revocation.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Doctor's report from Dr. Robert Rawski dated 3/23/15, filed.

Defendant Dominick M Smith in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Dominick M Smith in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Raj S. or Vishal V.

Defendant Dominick M Smith in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Dominick M Smith in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
